org.openscience.cdk.interfaces
Interface ITetrahedralChirality

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, ICDKObject, IStereoElement
All Known Implementing Classes:
TetrahedralChirality
public interface ITetrahedralChirality
extends IStereoElement

Stereochemistry specification for quadrivalent atoms. The data model defines the central, chiral IAtom, and its four ligand IAtoms, directly bonded to the chiral atom via an IBond. The ordering of the four ligands is important, and defines together with the ITetrahedralChirality.Stereo to spatial geometry around the chiral atom. The first ligand points towards to observer, and the three other ligands point away from the observer; the ITetrahedralChirality.Stereo then defines the order of the second, third, and fourth ligand to be clockwise or anti-clockwise.

Belongs to CDK module:
interfaces
Source code:
cdk-1.4.x

Method Detail

getLigands

IAtom[] getLigands()
Returns an array of ligand atoms around the chiral atom.

getChiralAtom

Atom that is the chirality center.

Returns:

getStereo

ITetrahedralChirality.Stereo getStereo()
Defines the stereochemistry around the chiral atom. The value depends on the order of ligand atoms.

Returns:
the ITetrahedralChirality.Stereo for this stereo element.
